meanings.sent1: The phone emitted a vibrative sound when it received a message.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake created a vibrative sensation throughout the building.
meanings.sent3: The vibrative alarm clock woke me up with its loud buzzing.
meanings.sent4: The music was so vibrative that it seemed to shake the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The vibrative hum of the machinery filled the factory floor.

meanings.sent1: The machine's vibrative movements could be felt from a distance.
meanings.sent2: The train tracks emitted a constant vibrative noise as the train passed by.
meanings.sent3: The vibrative dance performance made the audience feel like they were vibrating too.
meanings.sent4: The vibrative force of the impact caused the glass to shatter.
meanings.sent5: The vibrative energy of the music made everyone want to dance.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or relating to vibration.
meanings.sent1: The vibrative nature of the earthquake was unsettling to the residents.
meanings.sent2: The vibrative frequency of the sound waves affected the experiment results.
meanings.sent3: The vibrative atmosphere of the concert made it an unforgettable experience.
meanings.sent4: The vibrative quality of the material made it ideal for soundproofing.
meanings.sent5: The vibrative feedback from the speakers indicated a problem with the audio system.
